wikipedia_page.main:
Herbert Shutt (3 September 1879 – 19 November 1922) was an English first-class cricketer.
Shutt made his first-class debut for Hampshire in 1906  against the touring West Indians. Shutt played four first-class matches for Hampshire in 1906, with his final first-class appearance for the county coming in against Leicestershire.
In his four matches for Hampshire, Shutt took 8 wickets at a bowling average of 28.87, with best figures of 4/29.
Shutt represented Cumberland in two matches against Northumberland in 1912 and in one further match against Durham in 1914.
Shutt died at Whitehaven, Cumberland on 19 November 1922.
